intro: Lepidium bernardinum, commonly known as the Andean cress, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and ornamental plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has a peppery, aromatic flavor similar to mustard. Its leaves are often used in traditional Andean cuisine and herbal remedies. Lepidium bernardinum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in high-altitude environments.
